description:
I was looking for a breakfast that was not too heavy and I found a great one here.  Had the spinach & Feta breakfast wrap which had tons of fresh spinach and just the right amount of feta.  It seems to be a place visited by many locals.  The lady and man who were working knew many of the customers who would walk in and order their drinks and food.  Both employees are nice, although the lady is especially nice.  I think that the gentlemen is nice to locals whose order he knows before they make it, but not as friendly to tourists, although not unfriendly.  
Menu items consist of things made in house and brought in.  
In addition to many breakfast and menu items they also have a full coffee bar.  I just bought a plain coffee which was good, my only complaint would be that their only sweetener is sweet-n-low.  
If I were here another day this is definitely the place to which I would return
author: Scott A.

description:
The Saturday we were walking the streets of San Francisco, I was in dying need for a bagel. We must have walked 5-6 blocks without any bagel or donut shops, which I thought was odd. Finally on a random corner was this small deli with people sitting all along the sides enjoying cups of coffee during the brisk morning hour. Before I could tell my boyfriend "let's go", he was already in the door. I already fixed my eyes on what I wanted so there was no waiting period for me. The menu had a wide variety of things mostly, Mediterranean options, but my heart needed a bagel. 

I think the owner helped us out, a super nice guy. I asked him if I can build my own breakfast sandwich and he said "yup!"  I got a specialty bagel, with eggs, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, sprouts and avocado, then tacked on an ice coffee.  I was able to find a couple of seats outside while waiting for our order, so that was nice that were weren't forced to walk and eat our bagels. Very quickly our bagels were ready and MAN when I tell you, this bagel was outstanding! It's odd because there was nothing that was over the top about this bagel, but it was just so delicious. I must have inhaled my bagel as fast as it took to make because I looked up and my boyfriend was barely on his first bite. All in all Angel Café was a great little spot, a little pricy, but a good bagel spot!
author: Gabby K.

description:
I keep on coming back here hoping that it'll be better than the last time and it just never is. The overall reviews are great, ambiance looks super cute- maybe I just ordered the wrong thing last time. 

Wandering along Geary and too lazy to walk down to Starbucks, I go to Angel Cafe. Again. My mistake last time was ordering the Lox bagel with the least fresh lox I've ever seen in my life. This time around I thought hey- let's get a breakfast bagel, you can't go wrong with eggs cheese and bacon. But I was wrong. Eggs were a little green and I don't even know how, cheese wasn't even melted and was basically one of those square cheddar pieces you ate as a kid. I need to keep my promise to never return and to just walk anywhere else.
author: Leina K.

description:
A reliable neighborhood spot for quick breakfast items and Mediterranean tasty treats. The space itself will not inspire extensive Instagram exposes, and that's in part the appeal: It's a normal, solid place that provides relatively cheap, quality food in an increasingly precious, abnormal city. I regularly come here to pick up dolmas ($1 for two) or falafel ($1 each), which make a fine and satisfying breakfast on their own for basically no money. The spanakopita ($5) is a more fulfilling alternative and a worthy upgrade. It's also possible to build a great lunch out of these items plus the various salads without leaving the deli counter. Really the deli counter is the main event and the reason I go back.

They have the full complement of other coffeeshop choices, though neither the prices nor quality are show stoppers. The coffee is nothing special but adequate and they have a decent array of teas, and they have it ready and hot when you need a cup in a hurry. The bagels do their job. I haven't tried the yogurts though they look decent. In warmer months the outside tables make for a nice place to linger a minute, though the inside is a little cramped for serious coffeeshop lounging.

Service is fast and attentive and they make it clear they want my business and will customize orders and make recommendations. Buy them presents, or at least buy their falafel!
author: James D.

description: The guy who works here is SO nice it makes you feel awesome to shop here. Food is delicious and so many options - bagels, quiche, pasteries, wow!! Way nicer than I assumed from outside after having passed by here everyday. The fresh pasteries are particularly nice and they even have a bunch of Mediterranean wraps
author: Christina G.

description: This place is awesome. I had a lox bagel on Saturday morning and then an onion cream cheese bagel on Sunday morning. Great coffee.
author: Wendy S.

description:
This is a lovely neighborhood coffee and lunch place. With some tables outside for the perfect people watch and seating inside for those rainy and cold SF days. 

Stopped by here yesterday for a quick lunch - Greek Salad Chicken wrap, which so yummy, and a cup of parfait for tomorrow morning. Living in Europe now and I forgot that all prices in U.S. do not include tax :P what a strange thing to do ...
author: Anelya S.

description: Great spot for breakfast! The staff is very friendly & made me feel like I was at home.
author: Victoria P.

description: Angel Cafe is the perfect little neighborhood cafe for coffee, tea, delicious croissants, and doughnuts, or an afternoon meal or snack! There is always a good variety of whatever you are craving, and the manager/owner is the friendliest person in SF!!
author: Sheila K.

description: Absolutely love this place! I stop by before work almost every other morning to grab a bagel and coffee. I would rotate from plain cream cheese bagel to the San Francisco Bagel - which has cream cheese, tomatoes, and BACON. Absolute bomb! I have yet to try their sandwiches and wraps but I'm confident that they wouldn't disappoint. The owner and staff are exceptionally friendly and pay attention to how you want your food/coffee. Will definitely miss coming here in the morning when I move work locations but will definitely make a trip back just for my usual fix :)
author: Marielle D.

description:
Disclaimer: I am from SoCal and visited SF as a tourist... so if you're a local reading this, keep in that mind... I don't have your tasteful palette. 

Anyway, I am a lover of all things bagels for breakfast. On the outside, Angels Cafe & Deli doesn't look like much - it's got a blue awning and advertises its free WiFi and breakfast foods like pastries, etc. However, when you walk in, you see the hipster chalkboard menu and you're sold. Okay I'm only being half sarcastic - this place is amazing AF. They have a TON of different bagel breakfast sandwiches and it's very typical pricing so nothing to break the bank, but it ain't Mickey D's either. I myself got the Heavenly Breakfast Bagel Sandwich that comes with egg, avocado, red onions, cream cheese, cucumbers, and tomatoes. DELICIOUS. A perfect combination of each element and the avocado and cream cheese work seamlessly together. It's the best bagel breakfast sandwich I've ever had, and I'm from LA. If you're visiting, stop by here for breakfast - it's yummy, affordable, they've got free WiFi and it makes for a great Snapchat/insta story post. A must try and it's so quick and easy - none of that long wait.
author: Xiaopan X.

description:
Very friendly service. Of course I couldn't decide which cakes I want because they all look delicious. Instead of rolling his eyes, the staff kindly guide me through the selection and even offered to cut chunks out of the cakes for me to sample. Wow!
I proceed with chocolate cake and creme brule cheesecake.

Chocolate cake : Very, very rich and sweet. Very condensed. I couldn't eat it all in one go, since I will probably be very giddy afterwards.

Creme Brule cheesecake : Ooooh get this you cheesecake lovers! Silky texture, melt in your mouth with the accent of vanilla beans. Yes, yes, yesss~
author: Jenny T.

description:
I love when you first walk into a place and your impression is cleanliness and freshness. That's the way it is with Angel Café & Deli. They have a large selection of breakfast items, sandwiches, and hot drinks made to order. They also have a nice selection of prepared deli items, salads, quiches, etc. 

Today I had the chicken pesto sandwich. I love when you first bite into a sandwich and your immediate impression is of fresh and flavorful ingredients! I will be returning to the Angel Café & Deli soon!
author: Lou S.

description: My actual favorite breakfast place in the downtown/tenderloin/nob hill area! Always delicious, always really friendly service. The "heavenly breakfast bagel" is the best breakfast item on the menu.
author: Lara H.

description:
I love that place - right around the corner!

When I walk in the owner welcomes me with a warm and honest smile and some lovely words that make me feel like home. I'm studying abroad and he gives me the feeling of familiarity - like going to the bakery in your neighborhood and the lady across the counter knows your whole family story AND what you are going to order.. thats the feeling I have whenever I come to Angel Cafe & Deli. 

My everyday choice:

Heavenly bagel with ham (yes it is heavenly!), latte and orange juice!

Thank you for being so awesome and providing a focus of calm in this busy and sketchy part of the city!
author: Annika H.

description: Little hole in the wall, we found it by chance. The owner was very nice and accommodating. Service was great and food was amazing! The best devil eggs I've had in a while. :)
author: Antonio V.

description: I found this nice little cafe while traveling in San Francisco with my family. We were looking to get a quick bagel breakfast. Bagels are always tricky when you're vegan, but I was very pleased to find that they make vegan bagels! The man at the counter was very friendly.
author: Carina B.

description:
I had a disappointing visit to Angel Cafe recently while I was trying to cure my bagel craving.  I used to come here quite a bit but it seems recently they have hired some new faces in the FOH.  I came in on a Saturday afternoon and saw three newbies working behind the counter.  I ordered my usual (everything bagel with hummus, red onion, tomato and cucumber).  The guy who rang me up was a little slow, took him a few minutes to realize what I ordered, then tried to look at the menu to find the price, then took my money (no gloves...where are the gloves, the last guy used to changed his gloves like 6 times while I was in there giving me a nice sense of clean security!) 
I stepped aside and waited patiently for my delicious bagel. There was only one other guest in there eating already so I figured my order would be quick and efficient. I saw the cashier tell the girl working the food line what I ordered and although she looked a bit confused I figured they all had it under control.  A few minutes later, I see her holding up an everything bagel smeared with cream cheese and nodding to the cashier like (this is it, right?) He went over and told her that I ordered hummus and that was cream cheese.  I then saw the other staff member go over and try to just remove the cream cheese with a knife. LIKE JUST SCRAPE IT OFF NO BIG DEAL RIGHT? NOPE - BIG DEAL. I am lactose intolerant. I have really bad reactions to dairy, you know, things like CREAM CHEESE. So I ran over and explained that this wasn't okay (to just try and cover up the mistake) while the woman behind the counter quickly dismissed my concern and explained it wasn't my order.... not my order? There are no other customers in here???
Again, I stepped aside as to not hover over the staff messing up my morning bagel.  I quickly received my bagel sandwich, noticing a bit too quickly for them to possibly have re-toasted a new bagel and this was the one that they just scraped the cream cheese off of.  I took my bagel home and not wanting to risk getting sick just gave it to me fiance for breakfast as I didn't trust they actually made me a new one. 
I understand the employees are new but I think food allergies and dietary restrictions are kinds restaurant 101. Something you should take seriously with customers as to not make someone sick (ie trying to just scrape off your mistake doesn't work too well - remake it, eat the cost). Anyways, a once favorite place in the neighborhood I am now hesitant to return.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Neighborhood deli not bad for a pinch, but certainly not an every morning / day place due to high prices and a RIDICULOUS $10 min charge for cc

Paid $6.75 for a bagel breakfast sandwich with a dearth of egg, compared to my normal (and healthier) Starbucks RFT breakfast sandwich for $3.75 (which I can order ahead of time online)
author: Ryan B.

description: I love their chicken salad sandwiches! When I found out their chicken salad was cooked-to-order I knew it would be delish. I work in the area and needed a clean restaurant to eat lunch at. I wasn't having any luck locating a spot on yelp and even made it all the way to one Mexican restaurant, did a check-in and yelp informed me that they were below the standards of cleanliness. It's hard out here for a chick! But....walking for wellness one day led me to this small gem and their cleanliness rating is a wopping 100...can't beat that! Ever since then I've been coming to get sandwiches and just really discovered they offer breakfast. Totally a one stop shop. Love them!
author: Itika D.

description: I live nearby and occasionally work from home. This is a great spot for morning coffee and breakfast or lunch. Many options, great service, and good quality food.
author: Kyle N.

description:
Fresh, tasty food; great service; great atmosphere.
I came in today with a thoroughly empty belly, and left full and delighted by this neighborhood gem.  

Food: 
By the time I left, I had eaten a lamb gyro with garlic sauce, a spinach and feta spanakopita, a falafel, a dolma (stuffed grape leaves), a deviled egg, and a dirty chai (Yes, this is more than enough food for two people-- I was hungry.)  Everything was flavorful and freshly home made with care.  The food was seriously delicious, and so I kept trying more things.  Everything was reasonably priced, so it was easy to justify trying a lot of different menu items.  There was also a fridge full of amazing-looking desserts that I'd like to sample next time around.  

Service: 
The guy behind the counter (who I think was the owner) was amazingly friendly and welcoming.  I watched people come and go in the time I spent at the cafe, and I saw that he really had a genuine way of treating everyone special and making them feel at home, without being too chatty or it coming across as forced.  It looked like this is a regular spot for a lot of people in the neighborhood, and I can see why.  

Atmosphere: 
The word 'cafe' has been abused by a lot of places to the point of meaninglessness, but Angel Cafe is exactly everything that I want in a Cafe: 
(1) Great selection of coffee drinks
(2) Spotlessly clean
(3) Unpretentious
(4) Low-key vibe: you order at the counter, and sit at the little tables inside or outside.  Quiet and airy inside.  No one rushes you in or out.  
(5) Food for any appetite: pastries, bagels, desserts, sides, salads, sandwiches, all the way up through platters and entrees.  
(6) Reasonable prices

Could not have been more impressed.
author: Christian J.

description: So I already wrote this place a very extensive stellar review, but once I had finished, I realized that I had actually accidentally wrote it for Scullery, so had to delete it and rewrite this one - thus, it will not be as long as the original. With that said, this place is one of the best cafe's in all of San Francisco proper - the location is wack, but that's what makes this place even that much more important. The food is truly great - ranging from breakfast bagels, to lunch sandwiches, to pastries - everything is made with care and love, yes, I said that. The coffee is very good as well - I think it, dare I say, actually can compete with a couple of Philz blends!!!! YEP, I just said that too - it just has this smokey dark smooth flavor - I personally love it. Recommend. Check, check.
author: Nolan M.

description:
Second time here and it was a total let down. Not entirely because of food but the service attitude. 
My wife ordered a falafel wrap which was a little sour for anyone's taste. 
When the owner came around to ask around if everything was ok, we expressed our views in the nicest way possible. As soon as we finished, the owner started to argue that a humid it's supposed to be sour and didn't take the comment well. When we further explained it just seemed more tangy the response he gave was aggressive...wanting to tell us we don't know what hummus should taste like. 
To further add, the tiramisu this time was dry and seemed stale. This was on Sunday, one would assume they have fresh stuff. To sum it up, we won't be going there or bringing our friends there anymore.
author: Neil S.

description: Good prices, good food and good service.. Mediterranean food with a lot of typical lunch and breakfast choices.. great little spot for lunch or breakfast I'll be back. This is the best bagel and coffee shop I have ever visited!
author: Rayna R.

description: Fast, friendly, and tasty. We had asiago bagels and grabbed sodas to go. They were out of fruit, but we got bananas at the grocery across the corner.
author: Ben K.

description: Due to a series of unexpected circumstances, we ended up eating here twice in one day.  The food is tasty and there are a lot of choices - both normal cafe type goodies and also Mediterranean food - soups, salads, sandwiches, etc. They also make a great latte! The cafe has a cozy atmosphere and an extra area to sit downstairs.  The proprietor and other staff went out of their way to accommodate my elderly mother and myself. A nice local business to support!
author: Alexandra B.

description: This is such a great corner deli. The owner is so kind & friendly, and remembers my order every time I go in. It's clean, the menu is no-fuss, and the ingredients are fresh. It's one of the few places that make our neighborhood feel like home.
author: Sam C.

description: The breakfast food is decent, however you are missing out if you're not coming here for falafel. I order falafel wrap and dolma when I'm here. It's what you do.
author: Jenny K.

description: This is a great place for breakfast if you're staying at a hotel in the Tenderloin. They offer coffee and tea; hot and iced. There are dozens of different pastries available and many choices of breakfast sandwiches. Staff is friendly and quick. First Saturday there, I had the lox and bagels; the following Saturday, breakfast croissant with sausage. Next time I'm in the City by the Bay, I'll go back to try other breakfast combinations.
author: Nat F.

description: Horrid. Simply horrid. I got a latte and it used burned coffee beans, tasted watered down, and the soy milk had some weird crap floating around in it, like spoiled dairy. At least they remade it so it looked decent but only tasted like crap.
author: Jason F.

description: I'm not a religious person, but Angel Cafe is heavenly. Go here for breakfast. The food is #blessed, and the staff is the best.
author: Jordan H.

description:
I've seen this place because the blue awning on the corner is hard to miss, but I didn't try it until a few days after my hairstylist raved about it. I was impressed by the wide selection of menu items and the friendliness of the owners. I wasn't sure if Angel Cafe was a coffee + pastries type of cafe or a place to bring my hungry boyfriend for lunch, and it's definitely both! You can find anything from breakfast burritos & donuts to lasagna & sandwiches. 

The place has a decent amount of seating but it's not the best place for large groups (as is the situation with most cafés). I'm probably overselling at this point, but it's arguably one of my favorite spots in the tendernob.
author: Melissa P.

description: Love this place! Great customer service! Always smiling :) hidden gem  you can definitely tell its possibly family owned, im vegan and they are able  to accommodate any walk of life
author: Ashley T.

description: This is the best bagel and coffee shop I have ever visited! I had been craving a bagel sandwich and after researching Yelp I was so happy Angel Cafe & Deli was walking distance from my hotel. I ordered the Cheesy Scrambled Eggs on an Everything bagel with a cafe au lait and it was heavenly!! My husband ordered the lox and bagel and loved his as well. The menu has so many bagel sandwich options as well as lunch items to choose from. This place is truly a gem and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a coffee shop or a delicious place to grab breakfast or lunch without dealing with long lines or crowds.
author: Brooke G.

description:
I stumbled upon this amazing little cafe quite by chance while visiting the Bay Area with my father.  Generally, I don't eat breakfast.  My mornings are hectic enough without.  My Dad, on the other hand, needs to eat in the morning due to medications taken.  So on our first morning on our stay on Geary St, I had to search out something for my Dad to eat.

     After walking a couple of blocks, we spotted Angel Cafe on the other side of the street and agreed we would go check it out.  I'm incredibly happy that we did! We stayed in this area for five nights.  We ate at Angel every morning that we were there.

     I HAVE TO have my coffee in the morning.  The coffee here not only gave me the am fix that I so desperately need, it was delicious.  Like I said, I never eat breakfast.  I ate a breakfast sandwich there every morning I was there!  This isn't even mentioning how great the service is here.  I work in the hospitality industry myself and hold my endeavors to high standards.  This place obviously does as well.  Very friendly and actually caring that they are being quick while putting out a top-notch product.  

     One last thing!  Back in the day I worked for an Egyptian gentleman who made an amazing pastry with spinach inside.  I saw at Angel they had something similar. I'm certainly not an expert when it comes to Lebanese food, so I was immediately intrigued when I saw them in the case, I had to buy one!  I took my first bite and realized that this was indeed the pastry that I love and have actually MISSED for years.........except this one was even better!  Such a nice find.  If you are in the area definitely stop in.
author: Matthew H.

description: I don't know how they do it, but they serve literally the best cup of coffee in the city! I come here a few times a week as I'm heading to work and the owner alway greets me with a smile and remembers my order. Their coffee is amazing, but the bagel sandwiches are my true weakness. So good!!! I once picked up a sandwich for a friend and he kept saying how great it was. It's great to visit a family run establishment, and you can tell they care about their quality and service.
author: Megan Z.

description:
Love this cute little cafe!

After searching for another place to grab a good latte and a snack on our vacation--only to find that some places close WAY too early in the day--my fiance and I found this spot at around 3 pm. 

I was surprised at the huge selection of food! It was almost too much, but hey, more is better than less when it comes to food. ;) I had spanakopita, a chai tea latte, and a pistachio macaron. Weird combination, I know. Don't judge.

The chai tea was pretty yummy, and it really hit the spot after wandering around for an hour, looking for a place earlier. The spanakopita was DELICIOUS, and I got more than I was used to getting! I usually pay an arm and a leg for a tiny slice, but this place gave me two decently sized pieces for $5. Nice!

The macaron was perfect. I don't have words. Just go. Eat one. They're only $1. EAT ALL OF THE MACARONS.

The atmosphere was nice and very clean. We sat by the window to people watch. The lucky bamboo decor was a nice touch. There is cute outdoor seating, but if you don't want to deal with the noise of the city, while still being able to watch all of the activity, I recommend the window seats.

The service was great, too. The only person working there was this really sweet Greek (I think?) guy who was all smiles and very attentive to us. I don't really expect much attention in a cafe, so I was surprised. He was really sweet and came by and cleaned our dishes for us promptly. It was a wonderful way to start the day!
author: Jaimie C.

description:
Angel Cafe has an exhastive offerings: gourmet pastries, krispy kreme doughnuts, pannins, falafels, dolmas, coffees, mediterranean eats, huumus, sammies, the list goes on. ..

eats:
- falafel (.75) very large.
had spicy taste besides being cold
-dolma(.75)
dry, premade, cold.
when nuked, still cold, crunchy.
2.5 stars

leftovers:
-blaming myself for not asking if falafel/dolma was "fresh"
wasn't told. should the server have? 
-still, lots of goodies to choose, would skip mediterranean eats. premade, cold.
-service quick, friendly, 
3.5 stars
yep, giving them a pass. (for now).
author: Victor G.

description:
The coffee and food is excellent. The service is great too. It's definitely your standard coffee/sweets shop, but the attention to detail when making your food is what sets this place apart from any other lunch spot in the Tendernob area. 
I work down the street and this is definitely my go to. I can always expect a friendly greeting and healthy lunch options made with love.
author: Bryce M.

description: Very friendly staff and decent donuts.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
This is your standard SF Cafe in the tenderloin. It's cleaner than others and the people are nice and fast. 

What took this from 4 stars to 3 stars is the minimum credit card charge. I hate places that have that. I think with the ubiquity of credit cards, just face facts and start accepting them if someone is ordering a friggin meal. If I get a sandwich and a drink at your place, I should be able to use a credit card to purchase it.
author: Andrew S.

description:
YUMMY coffee, delicious food, and free wifi.  There are a few outlets so great for work.  The service is outstanding, super friendly people.

They have a crazy assortment of hot drinks, cold drinks, sandwiches, mediterranean platters, salads, and breakfast bagels.  Things like Iced Milky Way Latte, Iced Lucky Charm Latte, Italian sodas! Rubens and hot club sandwiches.

I don't think that the food is made to order, because I see them heating things up in the microwave.  But still delicious, affordable food.  

The little shop is a few blocks away from Union Square, and into the Tenderloin.  Situated on the corner of Leavenworth and Geary, it can be a bit sketch but not too bad during the day. I live three blocks away and make the trek as a tiny girl without much fear in my heart.  There is also a really big thrift shop a short way down heading west on Geary, for your browsing perusal after a cup of joe at Angels.

I heard they have a cool "hidden" lounge just past the counter, so I'll be back to check that out sometime.

Recommendations to the coffee shop, although not necessary: More art on the walls! Maybe some books and magazines. Twinkly string lights! The space could be a bit cozier, but I do love the plants. That's just from my completely unsolicited idea bank. They may like the clean and sparse decor look.
author: Super L.

description:
With a halo.

I was running a little early prior to meeting up with the Scapin group outing (apparently, walking does get me somewhere quick, unlike in the larger suburban areas) so I ducked into Angel Cafe, in addition to ducking from the impending rain showers.

Fantastically cute and quaint corner cafe, right on the corner of Leavenworth and Geary.  Tall dark wooden stools and tables dominate the outer L shaped area while the warmly lit display shelves and coffee counter hold their rank against the other side.  Helpful and cheery staff (they know their regulars, right down from the senior locals to the men working across the street on repairs) and a great selection of desserts and baked goods.  I opted for black coffee (small) and a yummy sweet looking square of Baklava.  For the insane total of $3.75.  He gave me a discount on the sweet confection!

Coffee is strong and bold, as it should be and paired with the Baklava, perfect to balance out the intense sweetness from the rose flavoured syrup and soaked sheets of phyllo.

An older gentleman commented on my book and told me that it was uncommon for him to see someone reading Solzhenitsyn.  He nodded his approval when I showed him the cover.

I miss this.

I miss the random comments from total strangers who attempt to take their time in breaking the silence.  I appreciate hearing about their thoughts.  This one left a smile on my face.

And set the tone for the rest of the day.

Once my coffee cooled, I hurriedly gathered my belongings and ran back out into the slight showers.
author: Miika M.

description:
The team at Angels cafe has been really amazing for the last three years. We have had our ups and downs like when one guy made feel like I was giving him fake money because I handed him a hundred dollar bill for a cup of coffee ( why cash only?) That was all the cash I had and I was in desperate need for my morning fix! It was either that or 200 pennies which they frown upon as well but I didnt want to give you laundry quarters! I didn't really feel bad about that experience since on the weekends I typically look worse than the homeless so I get it. 

Fast forward three years and most of the staff knows me and my dog and they know I need my coffee. I had to revise my review since I will be moving soon and I WILL miss them.
author: Lidia Z.

description: Came here for breakfast every day on my trip to SF. All their food is amazing. The owner is so nice! He was my favorite person to talk to the whole trip! He also gave us great tips on stuff to check out and places to see. Just such a nice environment to start our day every morning! Definitely come here! All the food is of great quality and super fresh!!! :)
author: Melissa R.

description:
I adore this little spot with my entire heart. 

Although I've lived about 45 seconds away from their front door for 8 months, I had yet to try this place until Monday. I don't know why. I pass it every day and think that I need to go in and try it, but never seem to get around to it. It wasn't until we had guests go and fetch us muffins and vanilla lattes on Monday that I gave this place a try, and I am SO glad I did. 

The muffins and coffee were both delicious, though the coffee especially. It's seriously some of the best I've had in a long time, and I'm pretty picky when it comes to coffee. I don't know what coffee voodoo magic they're working in this place, but it's spectacular. 

When I went in today, the woman behind the counter was kind yet to-the-point. I actually really liked her personality. She called out a greeting to me as soon as I came in, then came over and stood patiently as I decided what I wanted. I finally settled on a dirty chai and a piece of toasted almond cake from the pastry case. 

"Do you want one shots or two?" She asked, calm but slightly stern. 

"Hmmm, let's go for two." 

Then she gave me the most wonderful impressed-raised-eyebrow-and-approving head-nod duo that I have ever seen. Sort of pursed her lips as she did it. It's hard to recreate in words, but it totally made me laugh.  

She was fast, efficient, and friendly while she made my drink and retrieved my pastry. I only had my card, and offered to get cash from their ATM, but she told me that she would just charge the 50 cents extra for running the card since it's cheaper than ATM fees. When I checked out, though, she knocked off 25 cents to make it an even dollar amount. A nice little gesture. 

She then asked if I lived around here, then gave me a loyalty stamp card. 9 stamps gets you a free cup of coffee. 

I will definitely be back. The dirty chai is truly the best I have ever had, and I've probably had hundreds by now. People aren't kidding when they say that their chai is the best ever. The espresso and chai were perfectly balanced--I often find that chai taste gets drowned out by the intensity of the espresso in dirty chai's, but they marry beautifully in Angel's cup. The toasted almond cake is sitting in my fridge, so I've yet to try it, but it looks lovely. 

They have so many gorgeous pastries and desserts, along with a large array of savory foods, and a GIGANTIC selection of drinks. There's enough here to satisfy anyone and everyone. Highly recommended.
author: Ashley-Jayne O.

description:
Situation
- Sunday afternoon for lunch
- Ordered the Turkey Pesto Sandwich, Falafel, and Cheese Crisp

Pros
- The people that work there are friendly
- The Turkey Pesto was decent
- They take credit cards
- The have a few tables outside

Cons
- The Falafel and Cheese Crisp were bland
- $15 credit card minimum
author: Dipesh G.

description: So ma y options for food! Perfect if your into veggies or like super into veggies. Lol. Its awesome and great pricing!
author: BBOY T.

description:
This lebanese cafe is an amazing lunch spot: really affordable, fresh and a lot of organic choices! I and the boyfriend had the 

 -beef shwarma ( melt in your mouth goodness made with high quality organic beef, crispy wrap on the outside, the tender and perfectly spiced meat blends pefectly with the pickles) 
 -tabouli salad- perfect compliment to shwarma 
 -fresh squeezed OJ - yum (they also sometimes have papaya and watermelon) 
 -club sandwich 
 -baklava - amazing, must try 
 -drip coffee- strong smooth richness to finish off the meal and a strong caffeine kick to help us get back to work 
Also its pretty spacious- It was an unusually warm SF day so we moved from the bar in the front of the store to the back dining room (down the stairs) where it was a lot cooler. 

Nagham, thank you so much for providing such amazing food! I can't wait to go back and try everything on the menu!
author: Juliana L.

description: Friendly service, delicious mochas and cappuccinos, fresh sandwiches. Also my go-to neighborhood place when I want to grab a decadent dessert as the owners always have time to make a recommendation
author: Christine C.

description: I had the breakfast burrito which was very good. The staff was very friendly and let me substitute a few things since I don't eat meat. The coffee was pretty good. If you have the breakfast burrito you certainly won't leave hungry!
author: Michael M.

description: Go there almost everyday.  Restaurant is very clean and staff are personable.  Great food and coffee. Check it out.
author: Johnathan M.

description: Great little cafe for breakfast or lunch. Service is extremely friendly and efficient. Great latte's. Bathroom is nice and clean. Wifi is free and fast.
author: Dana M.

description:
This coffee is shop is about a block away from my apartment, so not only is it super convenient, but they have the best service! Nagam runs his shop like it's his baby, and he treats every customer like family! He always greets us with a hug or a smile. I believe it's his sister and father that work alongside him. The sweet lady behind the counter always makes our sandwiches to perfection and she's super fast! 

There was one time we had a huge order of about 3 sandwiches, 2 drinks, and 3 pastries and something was left out of the bag - no biggie. I realized it when I got home so I gave him a call, and he met me on my corner to personally deliver the forgotten item! What other shop owner does that?! 

My bf and I come here every weekend for breakfast sandwiches and dirty chai lattes. They have the BEST homemade chai I've ever tasted!!! I won't go anywhere else. 

I also like that they'll throw in a free homemade cookie every now and then. Today, we were surprised to find a little "lagniappe" in our goodie bag- they had thrown in a free piece of delicious blueberry bread! We'll be regulars for a long time!
author: Melinda B.

description:
This is a family owned business and the owner has reached out to fix my previous complaint. Which you don't see too often. As long as he is making the chai lattes we will be back, I think they are the best I've had. 

And as I said before the breakfast sandwiches are delicious! Overall I love this place and I will be back. Thank you Nagham for reaching out.
author: Justin W.

description: Had the lamb kefta wrap. They put potatoes in it which wasn't in the ingredients list. Was really mushy. Pastries looked good and there's a vegetarian menu.
author: Rafael S.

description:
I come in mostly for breakfast and/or coffee. My favorite is the bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel. My boyfriend likes the San Francisco bagel (cream cheese, tomato, and bacon) on everything bagel. 

The staff is always friendly. Sometimes my bus is coming right as I am ordering my coffee and they hurry to take my cash and pour my coffee so I can run out the door with it. I appreciate little things like that so much!

I need to come back for sandwiches around lunch time. I also want to try their coffee frappes, will report back. I expect good things.
author: Halley S.

description: Love this place. The people are very awesome and only the friendliest are hired. I come here every day to get a good snack and lighten the mood of my day. They always bring a smile to my face. 10/5 stars!
author: Nestor S.

description: The best bagel I have ever had!!!!! The staff are very friendly and the store is clean. Highly recommend "heavenly bagel" and "San Francisco bagel". They are my favorite!!!!
author: VIVIAN L.

description:
Service: 5/5
Food: Lebanese Platter, 5/5

The man and woman behind the counter were so nice and helpful the entire time my boyfriend and I were there. They were very friendly towards everyone who came in and were more than happy to grab us an extra napkin or fork. Every exchange with them was met with a smile. You can't help but love this place. 

As for the food, good lord it was delicious. From the lentil rice to the falafel to the grape leaves... I left very full and very happy. I can't wait to come back and try out the rest of their menu!
author: Tiffany Y.

description: This is my favorite place to eat breakfast and lunch in San Francisco... I went here 3 days in a row at one point and stayed to work for a while every time. The owner, Nagum, is an extremely generous, kind person who took care of my friend and I. The food is wonderful and fresh (with lots of variety!). I recommend the Heavenly anything. The atmosphere is fun and refreshing. The service is friendly and flexible. I love this place.
author: Kate M.

description:
Love this place! Family owned business that radiates excellent customer service and quality coffee drinks with a variety of food options (bagels, cookies, deserts, dolmas, salads, wraps, sandwiches, etc.). I've been to this place many many times and am never disappointed.

Things I usually get here: lox bagel, hummus bagel (vegetarian), chicken or beef shawarma (a-mazing). Green tea latte and Yerba Matte are to die for!
author: Irina P.

description: Love the Angel Cafe!   Came here for breakfast while I was in San Francisco for work.  The service was friendly.  The guy working recommended the "Heavenly Bagel" and it was delicious!  I will definitely be coming back again!
author: Dominique F.

description:
The TL is slowly but surely getting back on its feet with good cafe's.  One thing a cafe/coffee shop needs to be is OPEN EARLY!  Angel, usually is open by 7am, and the breakfast bagels are my favorite.

Friendly staff, and the back downstairs is a great place to get some work done if you need some quiet or for that matter, privacy in the case of a meeting.

I keep going back, and I will continue to go back.. 

Caprice sandwich is my fav at the moment.. and probably always will be!
author: John D.

description:
really love this place 
good breakfast burrito and best breakfast bagel
good service very clean
author: Michelle M.

description: Iced chai here is amazing! They have all sorts of pastries and sandwiches. They also have pasta, deviled eggs, different types of Mediterranean snacks. Very friendly staff, they have relaxing music that plays though the cafe. Located outside are some chairs and tables if you can't find seating inside. Best chai I've had so far.
author: Em F.

description:
"Great local coffee and bagel place for the morning caffeine fix"

When I travel and when I'm at home, I like to find local coffee shops to support rather than always reverting to Starbucks. Although, Starbucks is sometimes the most convenient and only option. 
I was staying in the Hilton at Union Square and came across Angel Café. Since it was walking distance, it was worth checking out. Yes I do realize there is a Starbucks inside of the Hilton, and I do go there a couple of mornings when I was in a hurry. 
Be careful walking to Angel Café, bring a buddy, it definitely gets a little sketchy on your trek over there. I definitely wouldn't make the short journey at night, for safety purposes, but in the morning it was just fine. 
Angel café is very tiny where you order, only a couple of tables there, but there's a "secret" room/hangout area that you can reach from the back. They have a lot of bagel options, delicious espresso, mouth watering pastries, and sandwiches. The owners are very friendly and helpful.
The bagels reminded me of being in Manhattan, they were fantastic! The coffee was also some of the best I had while I was in San Francisco. It's definitely worth the trip into Angel Café.
author: Amber B.

description:
We are on vacation, and were just looking for a savory snack in place of dinner and we wound up in the Angel Deli. The owner and his staff were exceptionally nice! The owner was simply genuine, in a way rarely seen - especially in  customer service.  The owner even slightly modified the "format" of one of his sandwiches so my friend could have a meat and cheese plate instead.  He took great care in making sure he made the orders just as we requested.  

While we were in his shop - a customer of his who had moved out if town stopped by to say a quick hello as she was in the area and passing by.  I can see this is a place that people would gravitate to just for the service.  Wait - did I mention the food was fantastic!?!
author: Tamara M.

description:
Very friendly staff with a genuinely caring, sweet, and giving spirit. 
This is a neat spot to come have an evening chat if you happen to be in the TL.

One of my favorite things about Angel cafe is their lounge area. In the left corner there is a small doorway that leads to a downstairs room with a unique atmosphere. The walls are lined with painted burlap sacs and they usually have a random movie from the 80s on that you probably forgot even existed- very nostalgic.

Their Chai Tea is very good- which is important to me, so I will definitely be back!
author: Stephie M.

description:
LOVE it! Went here several times during my trip to SF as it was located near my hostel.

Angel is a nice little corner cafe with a super friendly owner and employees. 

They have absolutely delicious slices of cakes priced around $3-$4. I tried a chocolate raspberry mousse cake. Heaven.

They also have a good selection of sandwiches, salads and mediterranean items (owner is Turkish or Lebanese). I had a falafel plate with hummus and tabouleh for lunch one day, it was $6.50  They have breakfast items too.

Few tables inside and a few outside as well.
author: Lauren M.

description:
14.03.29.       First visit   ... quick recap ... will update

Coffee .......... 4
Service ........ 5


The latte was very smooth and wasn't bitter.
Yeah I did gulp it down ... quickly so it was a quick accessment.

This review is really about the very warm and understanding staff (owners?)
Another word the service.

Quick recap:

  I was there because I was early for a dinner party @ Dong Baek.
  I order a latte in a glass cup.
  Looked around and when the drink was ready ... when up to pay

  *&$^ ... my wallet wasn't there ... (quick ver) ... check everywhere for 5 min
             ^%$#$^ I did not have cash nor I did not bring my credit card.

  They were still friendly and said I could pay next time!
  There wasn't any sign of ... yeah right or any doubt or disgust ... nothing
          they were still friendly even all that ... they trusted me!
  I told them I am going to a party ... I am going to get some money from my 
         friends ...
  They even offer a paper cup to transfer the drink and just pay next time!
  I quickly gulped the drink and rush to the restaurant and gotten the cash and
         returned to the coffee shop and paid them plus a big tip for the trouble.

  I will drop by there again not only give them service ... there were some
        dessert items in the fridge that were tempting!

  Very trusting and friendly people!
  Gonna try the other items on the next visit to balance the review and
     thank them for trusting in me!
author: S.K. Y.

description:
This place is still thebomb.com
Moms cooking is on point!
author: Pita Q.

description:
I love this place! Super friendly and I'm in love with their Salmon Bagel!
And don't miss their falafel wrap, it's also something that you will go back for.
I go here to use their printer and they are always helpful.
author: Linda E.

description:
(See pics)

I have walked by this place numerous times. Always wonder if it's just a coffee shop, until reading upon fellow Yelpers and know it's a full service 

Heavenly Angels with homemade pesto, hummus, mushrooms, tomatoes, sprouts and mozzarella was all chilled and great on a very warm day.

They also do full serve coffees on different espresso drinks. The espresso shot iced coffee was excellent strong. An absolute pick me up from lunch.

A big bonus point. It's hard to believe- a Mediterranean style cafe has a full case of pastries, desserts like Tiramisu, AND a full fridge of imported Italian desserts such as Crema e pistachio, flute limoncello, coppa stracciatella, etc. They are so OMG deliciously fatty without the guilty nutrition label. I am already head over heels! All these to-go(s) are in a full heavy glass. Beautiful and delicious.
author: T L.

description: Very accommodating, even close to closing. Clean, quiet atmosphere, welcoming. I had a fresh banana, a falafel wrap, easy on the tahini, and answered yes when asked if I liked it spicy. The food was fresh, the wrap was served pressed, and was packed with textures and flavors that should always be present in this dish . Delicious. Well done, Angel.
author: John L.

description: Wonderful cafe with good food and WiFi. Great people! The falafel wrap I had was very filling, and affordable. The house coffee isn't bad either!
author: Ben S.

description: Just visited from San Diego and went to this place every morning. They have the most amazing coffee.. I couldn't get enough of it. Also the staff was so nice! Where can I buy the coffee?! Someone please tell me!
author: Shaun B.

description:
We ate dinner across the street at the Asian restaurant (sorry can't remember what type of food right now). Anyhow, we originally came to city to go to the cheesecake factory but it was a long wait and I was like I can't believe they charge that much for cheesecake, haha. 

So we decided instead to eat at the Asian restaurant because it got good reviews on yelp and we were satisfied. I however still wanted cheesecake. Wouldn't you know it Angel Cafe was across the street and I said....I wonder if they have cheesecake there?

It was as if an Angel (pun) planned the day for us because, they did in fact have cheesecake!

Not only that but it was the kind I wanted! A cheesecake that was firm, rich, and had powdered cocoa dusted all over it. Not too sweet and you felt like once slice satisfied you. I was really happy the day worked out like it did and ever since then when I'm in the city and if I'm in the area I want to stop by. I tend to be around the area more now that I know the cafe is here ;D

I came by another time to make sure I didn't just imagine the cheesecake was good the first time I came and wouldn't you know it...The cheesecake was still good and the guys that helped us were just as cool and laid back as I remembered! Nice cafe.
author: Benny C.

description: Asked "how much is a bagel with JUST hummus", it's $4.99 so I said "OK just give me the complete hummus bagel with all the veggies". What do I get, a $5 bagel with just hummus. SMH.
author: chad l.

description: Putting a case of cheesecake, tiramisu, pie and the plethora of other dessert options at the front of your store is likely to get me in your door.  I was half expecting a witch to shove me in an oven after being lured in but no...I just ate a crap load of dessert.   Well played Angel, well played.
author: Dru P.

description: The bagel sandwiches are fresh, fast and delicious. The ice chai is really tasty and the service is very friendly. It's right around the corner from my house so I really enjoy stopping by for a quick breakfast on the way to work. I definitely recommend coming for the sundries tomato bagel if you're a vegan with an ice chai.
author: Amy A.

description: Good solid breakfast/lunch place. Large selection of pastries, donuts, bagels and breakfast burritos. Also I'll menu of lunch items too.
author: Sean M.

description: Delicious coffee and reasonable prices. Got the dolmas wrap, and some falafel, which were both super delicious. And it was rather busy when I got here and I still got my food and coffee in about 10 minutes. Will come back to try more of both the food and drinks.
author: Ryan H.

description: This was my second time here for lunch in four days and I am only in SF for five! The falafel is amazing! The falafel pita is a flavor explosion in your mouth and you can request it to be as spicy as you like. The owners are extremely friendly which I greatly appreciate. It is nice to be greeted by a smiling face and that along with great food turns me into a repeat customer.
author: Beth H.

description: Stopped in for lunch and must say I was impressed by cleanliness and the very tasty looking food on display. I had the Hot club sandwich and it was delicious the meat tasted fresh and veggies were crisp. A very polite staff and great food! Located in the heart of the Tenderlion it is one of S.F.'s hidden gems!!
author: Johnny T.

description:
Errand time called for a break. I needed sugar and caffeine fairly badly to cope with the day and various headaches. Yelp told me this little cafe was good and I should try it. I almost always listen to Yelp.   

The last review said they make amazing sweets I figured I should test that theory. Language was a slight barrier between me and the woman working but she was very nice and seemed genuinely friendly. She made me a wonderful latte and I chose some sort of light, flakey pastry with a delicious cream filling. Sitting there I was in sugary heaven for about 10 minutes. The laid back atmosphere was just what I needed to decompress and balance out my glucose levels (I swear some days I push myself towards being a diabetic).
author: Nick B.

description: Service needs some work, but overall good and coffee is good. I like the variety of desserts on the refrigerator case.
author: Donny S.

description: Very clean place with friendly staff and wide selection of foods. Sandwiches are abundant, all ingredients fresh. The service is expedite. Not cheap but not too expensive either.  They open early and the place is never too crowded, at least I haven't experienced any long lines for Sat/Sun brunch.
author: Sandra P.

description:
I cannot say enough great things about Angel Cafe.  I come here to work quite frequently and every time I go in I am treated as if I am a part of their family.  This place is ran by a Lithuanian family consisting of what I believe to be a dad, mom, son, and daughter.

They are soooo nice, and they make a ridiculous amount of excellent Mediterranean food from scratch.  Try the falafel wrap, and ask for it extra toasted.  My friend says the veggie burger is incredible as well.

They make a wide array of great coffee and tea drinks as well.

If you come into Angel and are craving something sweet, well they make tons of sweets from scratch as well.  Pie, cake, cookies, parfaits, and basically every other dessert you could imagine.

Their downstairs area is a beautiful atmosphere; dark, fun colored lights, burlap sacks covering the walls, random out-of-place decorations, and always more than enough seating.

I could really go on and on about how much I enjoy this cafe, but I think you should  just give a try yourself.  Go there for an afternoon when you have a lot of work to do, and you will see how great of a place it is.  Grab a drink, order some of their great food, head downstairs, and watch your productivity increase 200%.
author: Javin L.

description:
Quick, no frills breakfast? Yes.
Yummy breakfast burrito? Not so much.

I don't make many comparisons to food or food culture (especially since San Diego isn't exactly well known for culinary expertise outside of Mexican cuisine), but if there's one thing I know: it's a good breakfast burrito.

I've never understood why some cafés try to be an eater's one-stop-shop. Though I'm sure everything behind the glass counter is tasty, I just don't understand how anyone can master the art of cous cous, falafel wraps, pancakes, Mexican breakfast burritos, various pastries and roughly 7 billion other options. I'm more of a KISS fan (acronym for Keep It Simple Stupid... an old radio term), so I'd rather see a place with fewer offerings done well than a gaggle of food stuffs ranging from great to blah.

I met a few friends here last week for a quick breakfast before hanging out with naked fellows in Delores Park. Being a huge fan of burritos, I opted for their signature breakfast burrito, while my two amigas went with specialty bagels and pastries. Both of their meals were fab, but my order left a lot to be desired.

Again, not to compare apples to oranges... but who the hell steams burritos on a panini press? I watched them fill my tortilla with eggs, avocado, bacon and some other goodies... then they essentially heated it up on a George Foreman Grill. While I love the lean, mean, grillin' machine... I'm not a fan of warming burritos on them. It's just weird. The taste reflected my suspicions - just way, way off. I ended up only eating a few bites, then nibbling on my friend's plates. Exactly why I think some outfits should just stick to what they do well, as opposed to trying to please everyone.

The coffee drink I had was spot on, and the staff was really friendly. I'd totally go back another time, but it'll hot day in Antarctica before I order another breakfast burrito.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Great service and food.  A great place to see all your peeps as well.  I love their tabouleh salad.
I spilled part of my lovely espresso and the owner saw that i did this clutzy move and without even saying a word, he made me a fresh one.  What a sweet heart.
author: D B.

description: Been there twice since my last review. First time I bought and paid for a cert breakfast sando. They ran out of what I wanted but charged me for it. Then gave me doughnuts to equal the charge. Which I didn't want!!! Now I ordered 3 breakfast sandos again and didn't get what I asked for? When I stated the order was wrong they told me I must have made a mistake? I will never be back. They are a train wreck waiting to happen!!!!!
author: Michael T.

description: I came here after reading the reviews, and once again yelpers you did not disappoint me. The gentleman working was so friendly, and it was 6:45 am! The breakfast bagel I ordered was delicious and their coffee is strong, not watered down. Plus they offer Krispy Kreme donuts. What more could you ask for?
author: Caitie S.

description: Large homemade dolmas are the best!  The family that owns the place is friendly.  Good service.  There is a lot to choose from my favorites are the dolmas, baklava, chai iced tea, and the spinach triangle pie thing.
author: Cassandra S.

description: I love this place. Very clean and relaxing spot to get coffee and a light lunch. The owner here really takes care of the area near the cafe which also makes this corner a little bright spot here in the Lower Nob/Tenderloin area of Geary. I highly recommend this place. Plus they have free wi-fi!
author: Reasonably H.

description:
I think I ate an ossa here. Kind of a pastry filled with pork and rice. Super good. Lots of desert pastries as well. Coffee was tried on this day. Outside seating and a basement room that looked really cool. Super friendly and helpful staff.
Neat little place.
author: Adam O.

description: This Deli is near my mom's house and she brought me here to have lunch.  The man was very nice and he had a lot of made from scratch food, such as hummus.  He carries a large amount of mouth watering desserts and he makes any kind of sandwich you can dream up, within reason of course.  You feel right at home and the food is great.
author: Kyra S.

description:
Chicken Shwarma and Turkey Pesto were both delicious! The service is friendly and their desserts look incredible! 

NOTE: Minimum purchase on a card is $15.00. Otherwise, bring cash.
author: Jamie Y.

description:
It's conveniently located right by the 38, 38L bus stop, I'd always stop by before getting on the bus to get a latte+a breakfast bagel. Their breakfast bagel is perfectly toasted, cheesy, and packed with fillings. It's really big, so I always save the other half for other. They also have the best sandwiches ever. 

Staff is really nice here, you go back the second time and they'll remember you. 

They have a nice collection of middle eastern foods, they make them fresh every morning. 

It's a nice place to sit on the tall chairs and people watch too.
author: Erica L.

description: Came here because it was near our hotel and we were on the way to the airport. Had a couple of sandwiches (Reuben and Pesto turkey) along with some coffees, a dolmeh, and a bit of the highly recommended tiramisu (sp?) cake. All was very home-y tasting and not the one bit bad. Seating is sort of weird, and homeless people were around, but overall fine. The cash-only thing was a detractor for me. Particular highlight was the $0.85 dolmeh. Very good.
author: Aaron S.

description: Its a must try coffee shop in the area. Cannot say it is the best coffee but definitely they have amazing home cooked goodies. Staff is really friendly and willing to help for anything.
author: Lyra S.

description: The people working here are lovely and very attentive. Baked goods are delicious, great homemade Mediterranean fare (falafel wrap was delicious) aaaaand they have matte lattes! Best one (only one) I've had.
author: Alexandra V.

description: Hours are wrong. This was the 3rd location where the hours were wrong. I usually would not be upset. But when I am "guiding" people around and this is the 3rd spot where the place is closed, then I'm pissed. And especially pissed since we only tried to open the door after seeing someone come out. The door was immediately locked and then a guy came out to tell us "can't you see door locked, we're closed". This star is for the incorrect info. Their desserts might be good, but you can judge since we couldn't...
author: Tracie U.

description:
An outstanding five star grilled chicken and hummus sandwich in a very strong four star cafe. Let's talk about that sandwich:

It's as if the super friendly lady making it took it as a personal challenge to load as much chicken and hummus between two slices of week as she possible could. Um, you succeeded. Epic goodness in each and every bite. I only wish there had been more bites. 

Sugar free vanilla Americano towards the end was good too.

I only wish I wasn't told I had to go downstairs to use the wifi. Downstairs wasn't bad, kind of charming actually with tables, relaxing music and another counter where no doubt brilliant food was being made. But I really wanted to sit by one of the windows on the ground floor. It was a sunny day. Chilling in a cafe is also about watching city life go by. Oh well.

Breakfast looks good, as do all the house desserts. I'll be back, and there is a very strong chance four stars will get upgraded to five.
author: Jason B.

description: Angel, I love you! Delicious bites, the nicest and most wonderful people own this cafe. When I was thinking of moving to the Loin, I stumbled in here, drenched in rain and frustrated with the stressful search of apartment hunting. The moment I walked in, I was welcomed, warmed and fed. I go here nearly everyday now. Food is inexpensive and wonderful. Coffee is delicious! I love you Angel and I'll be sad if I ever move.
author: Eryn L.

description:
DOLMA & BAKLAVA

I love the DOLMAS at this place.  They are the best dolmas I have ever had.  Before eating Angel's dolmas, I thought all dolmas were the same and did not request nor crave them. Before Angel's dolmas, dolmas were just an item on a Mediterranean platter.  

They are 75 cents!  Under a freaking dollar.  Ask them to warm it up. I think someone's mom  makes them.  Mom magic!

The baklava here is soooo good.  I used to be addicted to them.   Lots of the baklava around the city found on the counters of markets are crap made in the midwest somewhere (seriously read the packages).  You can taste and smell the preservatives.  Ewww.  This baklava is superfresh and huge.  You should (if you are not a pig) cut it in half and enjoy it twice.  I was told this baklava is different from most because its Lebanese. 

I like some of the bagels desserts too!
author: Hillary L.

description:
This place is one of the more dependable and quality cafes in the area. The transformation they have made a few years back really has made them stand out on leav and Geary. The neat royal blue decor, sharp and clean, fit with an Internet cafe calmly situated in the back (sometimes with soccer or other sports on the tv). The family oriented, friendly staff have always been above and beyond friendly most of the time. The ladies making the sandwiches are hard workers and seem to be passionate and energetic. The owner. Pa and his wife are cordial and are regularly found working or buying local products in the area. 

The falafel sandwich is top notch..giant perfectly crisped ground goodness with homemade tahini, hummus, and an oober fresh cucumber salad stuffing the warmed lavash bread (I like to add avocado)..with a traditional lebanese pre meal of dolma or the traditional spinach and cheese or cheese and parsley stuffed yum yums. Phat deviled eggs, quality coffee..yes, minorly overpriced, a few numbers could be dropped a bit..but overall this spot has served my senses well for years.do it
author: Adam B.

description: Super friendly owner chatted with me and even gave me a chai latte when I had already paid and wanted to add it to the order. Great fresh sandwiches. Almost makes up for the girl who was grabbed by a homeless guy on the tables outside and then her bf started a fight with him. Classy. Recommendation - take it to go or stay inside!!
author: Megan C.

description: I am just eating the best lox bagel on this planet ! Cheese bagel lox soooo good !! Also ordered a medium latte, very flavorful. I always go to Angel cafe, well whenever i have cash lol The 2 people who work there are super nice, smiling, make great food, smile at me, i mean come on what more can i ask for! Thanks guys, keep up the good work :)
author: Meriem B.

description:
I love this place! Fresh, inexpensive food. Clean and comfortable. Excellent friendly staff. Quick service, usually. Large, clean bathroom. I usually go in the off hours, get a sandwich and tea, read and relax. 
I've also had breakfast and dinner there. The morning customers seem to be mostly to-go. Less busy in the evening. Regardless of how busy, the staff of one or two works fast and remain friendly. I think there's only two people on staff, one guy and one girl.
I like to hang out here often and always use the fabulous, clean bathroom before I leave. 
I love that it's clean, quiet, and well-lit. It's perfect for a leisurely meal with a good book. Also great to hang out with my better-behaved friends, but not for a large group.
author: A L.

description:
This place is located on a very busy street Geary & Leavenworth so, I am sure it takes in a good amount traffic during stores hours. They have a good selection of deserts to choose from. 
Now I am not against Costco I am "Costaholic", but thats another review. Some of the traditional pastries are from Costco namely the muffins. They plastic wrap the muffins, and charge a few dollar more than what it would cost for a tray at Costco. 
The other deserts are not from Costco, and are really good. I got a Napoleon which is a flaky pastry with creme layers. It held up well during transport home. 
I ended up getting 2 muffins, 1 Napoleon, and a Naked smoothie spending about 13 dollars. It's a good place for a quick desert!
author: Nathan M.

description: When my boyfriend happened across this unassuming corner cafe on a visit to San Francisco, we knew we'd found a gem. Not only are the hummus and veggie bagels delicious, but the family who runs this place is genuinely kind and friendly. Every time we're in the city, this is the first place we go for breakfast.
author: Lara D.

description: My family and I stopped in for a quick lunch and we were happy to find that this was the place we were looking for. The sandwiches were fresh and of a size that I ended up finishing not only my own but also my wife's and daughters. Very enjoyable.
author: Blaine I.

description:
This place has saved my butt on several occasions. 

I somehow always find myself starving and slightly more buzzed than I'd like to be around 9:30 pm on Fridays. Luckily, I've been able to sneak in here last second and scarf down their tasty falafel goodness before returning to the delicious libations basically next door at Rye or down the street at Whiskey Thieves.

While their falafel is tasty and, yeah I'll go there, somewhat life-saving, I can't comment on any of their other food. Service is friendly enough. Atmosphere is slightly lacking and has an unspoken...hostility? or tension?... I can't quite place it...about it that made me want to eat and run.
author: Monica C.

description: Lovely people. Great for breakfast sandwiches and hot chocolate
author: Daniel C.

description: This place is over priced. A hot pastrami sandwich should have a large amount of meat on it for anything over $7. Although tasty an upgrade in portion would make this place much better. Also the tiramisu was a bit stale.
author: Jake R.

description: Fantastic service!  The wrap was very good.  The espresso was even better!  Took a canolli home and it was also delicious.
author: April M.

description: The pastrami on sourdough was pretty darn good here, nice clean cafe in the downtown area.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Try their Latte.

The lady that works there and makes the lattes is on it.  My tongue is never burned.  It is always the perfect temperature.

Give this place a go!
author: MacKenzie P.

description:
Best...Falafel...EVER!!

After my sad falafel experience at the more chain-like Ayola, i almost felt like i had to find a better one. I've also have had a pregnant woman craving for Baklavah lol ^.^ This is Sanfrancisco, shouldn't be that hard right?? I came across Angel Cafe. This bright blue corner cafe is really close to where i live. It's definetly family owned, clean, and everyone is so so sweet- customer service spot on with added charm. It gets really busy at lunch and the place is alittle small to keep up with their hustling business. I wasn't the only one getting a Falafel wrap *which was promising* Someone infront of me was getting this sandwhich which was filled to the brim with meats and cheeses. It looked good if i ate that kind off stuff.

The Falafel was perfect. Filled with vegetables i never expected. Zuccini, cherry tomatoes *you could tell they were locally grown*, thick chunks of cucumbers, onions, some homemade pickled vegetables, afew pieces of broccoli, grape leaves, fresh herbs, and some spicey peppers since i ordered it spicey. The yougurt sauce had good flavour. The hummus had a wonderful light earthyness to it. The wrap was soft, thin, and warm. It wasn't made with refined flour, and had an almost sweetness to it. The falafel itself was huge. I've never had falafels like this, it was not made with abunch of breadcrumbs. It was soft but had a slightly crunchy but not hard outerwhell. They were huge and filled throughout the whole wrap. It was wrapped tightly so everything was kept in place *which most wraps never are* so it was easier to eat, it was wrappy in parchment paper and then again in foil to keep it warm and in place. This is by far the best falafel i have literally ever fricken had. 

I have never had Baklavah that tasted this traditional either. It was good. The portion seemed small until i took it home and saw how thick it really was. Perfect portion.

I paid $10 even for a falafel wrap and piece of Baklavah. It seemed over priced to me until i went home and really looked at what i ordered. The falafel wrap was HUGE. I couldn't really finish it but i did just because it was that awesome. It essentially is the same price as Ayola, but the wrap its like 1/3xs bigger. Plus Ayola is alot of bread and lettuce, Angels is little bread but tons of fresh local vegetables and huge falafels with just the right amount of sauces. The Baklavah was really good as well. The flavours was spot on. They have a pretty exclusive menu with alot of coffees, sandwiches, traditional greek foods with some pastries. 

I figured if i could not get traditional good greek food at a family owned/run traditional cafe, then there was no hope for good decent priced mediteranian in frisco- this place did not disapoint. This place is AMAZING. Run with smiles and love. Everything is homemade and fresh. You can tell they are happy and love what they do. The area really isn't that bad. If you think this is in a bad area in SF u have no idea lol. The area is fine. Any area you can still text in without risk is not a bad area lol. 

So impressed, i look forward to coming here in the future to trying other things, however the Falafel is beyond perfect so it's hard 4 me 2 imagine getting something else.
author: Brittainie B.

description:
I like it, I like it!  I stopped by spontaneously today for lunch to try Angel Cafe as I passed by it a ton of times on the Muni 27 and was always curious.  I ordered the Pesto Turkey sandwich on sourdough bread.  It was very tasty with homemade pesto sauce, fresh alfalfa sprouts and toasted bread.  So good!  I enjoyed half of it in this cozy cafe and wrapped the other half to enjoy at home later for dinner.  I also ordered two falafel to go which I just snacked on and totally enjoyed.

The deli case full of potato salad, deviled egg, dolma, falafel, and the dessert case with an assortment of cakes and pastries looked very interesting!  And I just read that they have organic coffee - hmmm!  Can't wait to bring my boyfriend back here for lunch very soon!

P.S.  I also saw the "Loved by Yelp!" sign in the window - this review is another testament to their good business.  Keep it up!
author: Maile N.

description: Wonderful falafal & nice people. Not those overfried rocks you get some places, but moist yet crispy deliciousness with seeds on the outside! Pick up one sometime and you will be hooked. Because they are not overfried, they also reheat well in the microwave.
author: Ria J.

description:
Santacon stop #3

Johanna N. and I made a quick stop here between bar hopping because we both got really jolly early on in the day. 

Couldn't find any appetizing places around this block of Geary, so Angel Cafe was wearing a halo by default. It is a mom-n-pop establishment, and Pop took my order -- caprice sandwich -- while I oogled the dishes in the glass cases. Everything was Greek to me, even though most of the dishes seemed to be Italian/fusion.

There's free wifi, but you have to sit in the back, which seemed kinda sketch. For my sandwich and a bag of chips, it came to $7.45.

I'd try the place again, and when I do, I will be sure to be a little more coherent.
author: Nicole P.

description:
This place is cool; it's really damn cool.

I've seen this place for a while, walking past it while walking to work and what not and it never really looked like anything special...until I walked in.

They have such excellent snacks! I should note that I don't drink coffee so I can't tell you how that it, but I can say some of their non-coffee drinks are pretty damn good too. 

That explains all the people enjoying the sun outside of the place, what little sun SF offers anyway. It's a nice relaxing spot. The owner is cool; his daughter is cute; pretty girls drinking coffee all over the place. Let's not lie, that what counts right? Also, hot yummy food FTW.

Be warned, it's cash only. There's an ATM inside, but it's one of those $2.50 use, sketchy looking TL jobs.  If you're like a lot of people that have a BofA cards, then you know that they'll naughty touch you for using ATM's that don't belong to them in the form of an additional free on top of the fee you already paid. Screw that! 

Walk with cash people and enjoy Angel Café.
author: Shirrod R.

description: I just wanted to say thank you to the family who runs Angel Cafe. I was in here about three weeks ago for my Mandarin lesson with my teacher. I bought a pastry that had meat and onions in it. Unfortunately when I was moving my books and papers around, I dropped the 3/4 of the pastry that I had been eating. I shrugged it off but was happily surprised when the lady from behind the counter gave me a new one free of charge. This not only displays unexpected kindness but good business sense. If I'm in the Civic Center area again, I'll definitely go back for their tasty snacks/drinks!
author: Courtney L.

description:
I can't believe I'm so lucky as to live right down the street from this joint. I paid my very first visit last week and became completely smitten. Starbucks be gone, the Angel is flying high.

The coffee here was totally yum but the egg bagel was SO GOOD. I'm used to the breakfast sandwiches from Starbucks which absolutely pale in comparison to these. I ordered the sausage, egg and cheese on a whole wheat bagel. I told myself I'd only eat half but after I got started there was no way that was happening. To. Good.

I'll be back this weekend fo sho with my new pup Ru to sit outside and enjoy my precious time off.
author: Julia N.

description: Great corner cafe, I had the turkey pesto sandwich... huge fan of pesto and these guys got it good! Tastes like a splash of vinegar is in it... perfect. Bravo!
author: Calvin G.

description: I love these guys!  It's my neighborhood cafe, and I go there every morning.  They're always friendly.  Their coffee and food selection are great!  Highly recommend checking them out.
author: Rachel P.

description:
ANGEL IS THE SHIT!

seriously best cafe in town, and let me fucking tell you 5 reasons why.

1. The Family- Angel is clearly a family run operation and that is awesome. Not  a bunch of punk ass hipsters scoffing at you behind their coke bottle glasses. The son who pretty much runs the show there is the shit; always in a good mood, willing to accomodate any need you may have. The pops, is the true boss though. Wandering around, meeting and greeting the patrons, treating you like one of his own, which can be somewhat awkward at times, but is nice and makes you feel welcome. The sister? who makes all the food, does so with care and consideration you aint gonna find anywhere else.

2. Internet- at Angel its free, no janky need to pay to get a code bullshit like other places. They let you in and let you on the interwebs. nough said. 

3. The atmosphere- you want a place to chill out in the sun and relax, Angel has you covered. The outdoor sitting is relaxed and framed by white  fences, your on the seat but in your own space. This part of town is also warm and lacking the sometimes obnoxious SF gale force winds, so you can actually sit outside and not feel like a shcmuck with your hair blowing all over the place. AND if you wanna get some actual work done! Angel has you covered too. Their "cave" in the downstairs is the perfect work space. Dim lighting which can be booster in each section, if you personally require more light, and the cozy warm space is perfect for when you need to tuck in and get some shit finished. They even have news running on the T.V. so you can keep up with what the fuck is going on in your world, cause we all know you dont read the news !!!

4. THE FOOD. The food at Angel, is Angelic. They prepare pretty much every dish at this place by hand, you can see the mother in the back slaving away to make all the dishes with ingredients from scratch, I mean cmon! that is fucking epic. And if you want some upscale sweets, they got treats to treat. Mostly a mediterranean cuisine, which is bomb and healthy for you. No transfat in this place people.

5. Utilities. So I mentioned the internet, but did I also mention if your broke ass doesnt have your own PC you can use the ones they have there! Cheap access, and they have a printer, which is even wireless as well! Angel is on the cutting edge of tech, and they got an ATM, and take card as well, none of this cash only bull.

If you havent been to Angel, do yourself a favor and go, its the perfect spot to work or kick it, and they will always server you with a smile.

At Angel you get heavenly treatment.
author: A B.

description: A great neighborhood spot for coffee and pastries with consistently great service.  They also have a good selection of Mediterranean food.
author: Carlos C.

description:
I joined yelp just to put up a review about this restaurant. I've had a lot of Greek and Middle Eastern food and have to say this place is fantastic. I had an ozze (flaky crust wrapping rice, lamb, nuts, raisins and more), two falafel with hummus and two fig cookies. Wow! The ozze was really fantastic and a must-try if you're in the neighborhood. Eating outside was fun as well. My first trip to San Francisco for a show, and having eaten at a few great restaurants (including Roys mmmmmm great lamb there too and Mel's for breakfast) I'd say Angel Cafe is the hand's down winner (and a fraction of the price even though Roys was scrumptious) :)

LOL I see I'm contradicting the most recent review but, I stand firmly with my recommendations. Everything was quite tasty (and I'm not so easily won over).
author: Jerry H.

description:
Best cafe in the Tender-Nob hands down. Friendly people, family owned, clean place and awesome food. My favorite is the San Francisco Bagel (choice of bagel w/ cream cheese, tomato and BACON!)
